text:
According to an email on the log4j-user mailing list on 8/3/2007, EXCEPTION is a
reserved keyword in the Derby database engine and can't be used as a column name.
creator: sdeboy@iname.com

text:
Fixed in commit 566490

I chose to rename the EXCEPTION column to THROWABLE.  This issue may arise with
the TIMESTAMP column as well.

I thought about supporting fallback column names, appended with _COL (for
example, if the EXCEPTION column was not in the result set, look for the column
EXCEPTION_COL), but for now, it didn't seem necessary.
creator: sdeboy@iname.com
